Class ServicePoint

java.lang.Object
MVC.simu.model.ServicePoint
public class ServicePoint extends Object
Represents a service point in the simulation, managing a queue of applications, service processing, and performance metrics. Supports multiserver (employee) logic, tracks waiting and busy times, and interacts with the controller for visualization.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructs a ServicePoint with the given generator, event list, event type, and controller.

  • Constructor Details

    • ServicePoint

      public ServicePoint(ContinuousGenerator generator, EventList eventList, EventType type, IControllerMtoV controller)
      Constructs a ServicePoint with the given generator, event list, event type, and controller.
      Parameters:
      generator - Service time generator
      eventList - Event list for scheduling
      type - Event type for this service point
      controller - Controller for visualization and updates

  • Method Details

    • getEventTypeScheduled

      public EventType getEventTypeScheduled()
      Gets the event type scheduled for this service point.
      Returns:
      EventType scheduled

    • setEventTypeScheduled

      public void setEventTypeScheduled(EventType eventTypeScheduled)
      Sets the event type scheduled for this service point.
      Parameters:
      eventTypeScheduled - EventType to set

    • getServicePointName

      public String getServicePointName()
      Gets the name of this service point.
      Returns:
      Service point name, or "Unknown Service Point" if not set

    • addQueue

      public void addQueue(ApplicationAsCustomer application)
      Adds an application to the queue and attempts to start service if employees are available. Updates metrics and visualization.
      Parameters:
      application - Application to add to the queue

    • removeQueue

      public ApplicationAsCustomer removeQueue()
      Called by the engine when a service completion event for this SP occurs. Removes the application from the in-service list, updates metrics, and attempts to serve the next customer.
      Returns:
      The application that completed service, or null if none

    • beginService

      public void beginService()
      Starts service for as many waiting customers as there are free employees. Moves customers from waiting queue -> inService and schedules completion events.

    • isReserved

      public boolean isReserved()
      Checks if all employees are busy.
      Returns:
      true if all employees are busy, false otherwise

    • isOnQueue

      public boolean isOnQueue()
      Checks if there are applications waiting in the queue.
      Returns:
      true if queue is not empty, false otherwise

    • getQueueSize

      public int getQueueSize()
      Gets the current size of the queue.
      Returns:
      Number of applications in the queue

    • getTotalDepartures

      public int getTotalDepartures()
      Gets the total number of applications that have departed.
      Returns:
      Total departures

    • getAverageWaitingTime

      public double getAverageWaitingTime()
      Gets the average waiting time for applications.
      Returns:
      Average waiting time, or 0.0 if no departures

    • getMaxQueueLength

      public int getMaxQueueLength()
      Gets the maximum observed queue length.
      Returns:
      Maximum queue length

    • getUtilization

      public double getUtilization(double simulationTime)
      Calculates the utilization percentage of employees over the given simulation time.
      Parameters:
      simulationTime - Total simulation time
      Returns:
      Utilization percentage (0-100)

    • getNumEmployees

      public int getNumEmployees()
      Gets the number of employees (servers) at this service point.
      Returns:
      Number of employees

    • adjustEmployees

      public void adjustEmployees(int newEmployeeCount)
      Sets the number of employees (servers) for this service point. Ensures the number is at least 1.
      Parameters:
      newEmployeeCount - Desired number of employees

    • checkBottleneck

      public void checkBottleneck()
      Checks for bottleneck conditions and increases employees if queue exceeds threshold.
